tool.name: TSEBRA
tool.command:
tsebra.py
#if $gtf_file -g '$gtf_file' #end if #if $keep_gtf -k '$keep_gtf' #end if #if $hint_file -e '$hint_file' #end if #if $cfg_file -c '$cfg_file' #end if
#if $ignore_transcrpts --ignore_tx_phase #end if #if $filter_exon --filter_single_exon_genes #end if #if $score_tab --score_tab '$output_tab' #end if
-o '$output'

param.name: keep_gtf
param.label: Gene prediction list
param.help: All transcripts from these gene sets will be included in the output

param.name: hint_file
param.label: List of files containing extrinsic evidence

param.name: cfg_file
param.label: Configuration file
param.help: Find the recommanded parameter at config/default.cfg

param.name: score_tab
param.label: Print the transcript scores as a table to the specified file

param.name: ignore_transcrpts
param.label: Ignore the phase transcripts while detecting clusters of overlapping transcripts

tool.help:
tsebra_ TSEBRA is a combinatorial tool that selects transcripts from genetic predictions based on support by extrinsic evidence in the form of introns and start/stop codpns. This tool has been developed to combine BRAKER predictions.
.. _tsebra: https://github.com/Gaius-Augustus/TSEBRA
